section.p: Riders come toward you over the brow of a low hill. Their steeds are not horses but giant flightless birds whose powerful legs propel the group toward you with frightening speed. The riders hold long lances, and their mounts have vicious-looking beaks - an unpleasant combination.
One rider, a squat nomad in stinking leather armour, with a long greasy moustache, charges ahead of the rest, intent on impaling you with his lance.
